Client#

A SelfBotClient.client is used to send methods to all SelfBotClient.user#

class SelfBotClient.client.Client(api_version, loop=None, logger=True, request_latency=0.1, ratelimit_additional_cooldown=10, use_threading=False)[source]#

Bases: HTTPClient

Client supports all services of the SelfBotClient.user. It has methods such as Client.send_message which it calls in all users.

Parameters:

  • api_version (Literal[9, 10]) â€“ version of the discord api used by the client

  • loop (Optional[AbstractEventLoop]) â€“ Set the event loop that will be used by the client

  • logger (bool) â€“ Enable/disable the logger

  • request_latency (float) â€“ Control the rate of requests sent to discord

  • ratelimit_additional_cooldown (float) â€“ Add a cooldown to the ratelimit

  • use_tasks â€“ Enable or disable the tasks option (SelfBotClient.tasks), which for now is in beta.

  • use_threading (bool) â€“

async for ... in add_reaction(channel_id, message_id, emoji)[source]#

The add_reaction function adds a reaction to the message with the given ID in the channel with the given ID. The emoji parameter is a string that must be an emoticon. Example: ðŸ”¥

Parameters:

  • channel_id (int) â€“ Specify which channel_id the message is in

  • message_id (int) â€“ Message ID that you want to add a reaction to

  • emoji (str) â€“ A reaction to add to the message

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

await ban_member(guild_id, user_id)[source]#

The ban_member function is used to ban a member from the guild.

Parameters:

  • guild_id (int) â€“ Specify the guild that you want to ban a user from

  • user_id (int) â€“ Specify the user that is to be banned

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

async for ... in ban_members(guild_id, user_ids)[source]#

The ban_members function is a coroutine that takes in a guild_id and user_ids list. It then iterates through the users list, popping off the first user id from the user_ids list and passing it to ban_member function of each client. The response from each client is yielded back to whatever called this function.

Parameters:

  • guild_id (int) â€“ Specify the guild to ban the user from

  • user_ids (list[int]) â€“ Store the list of user ids that will be banned

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

async for ... in create_channel(guild_id, name, channel_type, topic=None, user_limit=None, position=None, nsfw=False)[source]#

The create_channel function creates a channel in the specified guild.

Parameters:

  • guild_id (int) â€“ Specify the guild id of the server you want to create a channel in

  • name (str) â€“ Specify the name of the channel

  • channel_type (ChannelType) â€“ Specify what type of channel you want to create

  • topic (Optional[str]) â€“ Set the topic of the channel

  • user_limit (Optional[int]) â€“ Set the maximum number of users allowed in a voice channel

  • position (Optional[int]) â€“ Set the position of the channel in the list

  • nsfw (Optional[bool]) â€“ Determine whether the channel is nsfw or not

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

async for ... in create_role(guild_id, name, color=None, hoist=False, permissions=None)[source]#

The create_role function creates a role in the specified guild.

Parameters:

  • guild_id (int) â€“ Specify the guild in which you want to create a role

  • name (str) â€“ Set the name of the role

  • color (Optional[RGB_COLOR]) â€“ Set the color of the role

  • hoist (Optional[bool]) â€“ Determine whether the role should be displayed separately in the user list

  • permissions (Optional[PermissionBuilder]) â€“ Set the permissions for the role

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

await delete_channel(channel_id)[source]#

The delete_channel function deletes a channel from the server.

Parameters:

channel_id (int) â€“ Specify the channel that is to be deleted

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

async for ... in delete_channels(channel_ids)[source]#

The delete_channels function takes a list of channel_ids and deletes them. It returns an AsyncIterable of ClientResponse objects, which can be used to check the status code for each request.

Parameters:

channel_ids (list[int]) â€“ Specify the list of channel ids that will be deleted

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

  • user_id (int) â€“ Specify the user whose reaction is to be deleted

  • emoji (str) â€“ Specify the emoji to be deleted

Return type:

  • guild_id (int) â€“ int: Specify the guild that you want to delete a role from

  • role_id (int) â€“ int: Specify the role_id to be deleted

async for ... in delete_roles(guild_id, role_ids)[source]#

delete_roles function removes all roles with id in the list

  • role_ids (list[int]) â€“ Specify the roles that are to be deleted

await edit_member(guild_id, user_id, nickname=None, add_roles=None, remove_roles=None)[source]#

The edit_member function allows you to edit a member of a guild.

Parameters:

  • guild_id (int) â€“ Specify the guild that you want to edit a member in

  • user_id (int) â€“ Specify the user that you want to edit

  • nickname (Optional[str]) â€“ Change the nickname of a user in a guild

  • add_roles (Optional[list[int]]) â€“ Add roles to a user

  • remove_roles (Optional[list[int]]) â€“ Remove roles from a user

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

guild_id (int) â€“ Specify the guild id of the server you want to get banned users from

Return type:

async for ... in get_channels(guild_id)[source]#

The get_channels function is a coroutine that takes in a guild_id and returns an AsyncIterable of ClientResponse objects. The function can return the data of all channels on the server

Parameters:

guild_id (int) â€“ Specify the guild id of the server you want to get channels from

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

await get_member(guild_id, user_id)[source]#

  • user_id (int) â€“ Specify the user id of the member you want to get

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

await get_reactions(channel_id, message_id, emoji)[source]#

The get_reactions function returns a ClientResponse with list of users that reacted with the specified emoji.

Parameters:

  • channel_id (int) â€“ Identify the channel that contains the message

  • message_id (int) â€“ Identify the message that is being reacted to

  • emoji (str) â€“ Specify the emoji to get reactions for

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

async for ... in get_roles(guild_id)[source]#

get_roles returns a list of data with all the roles on the server

await kick_member(guild_id, user_id)[source]#

The kick_member function kicks a member from the guild.

Parameters:

  • guild_id (int) â€“ Specify the guild that you want to kick a user from

  • user_id (int) â€“ Identify the user to be kicked

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

async for ... in kick_members(guild_id, user_ids)[source]#

The kick_members function is a coroutine that takes in a guild_id and user_ids list. It then iterates through the users list, popping off the first user id from the user_ids list and kicking them from the specified guild. It yields each response as it goes.

Parameters:

  • guild_id (int) â€“ Specify which guild the user is in

  • user_ids (list[int]) â€“ list with id of people to kick out

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

login(tokens)[source]#

The login function is used to check the provided tokens.

Parameters:

tokens (Union[str, list[str]]) â€“ tokens to check

Return type:

None

The send_message function sends a message to the specified channel.

  • channel_id (int) â€“ Specify the channel to send the message to

  • message_content (str) â€“ content of the message

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

await unban_member(guild_id, user_id)[source]#

The unban_member function unban a user from the guild.

Parameters:

  • guild_id (int) â€“ Specify the guild that you want to unban a member from

  • user_id (int) â€“ Specify the user id of the member to unban

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

async for ... in unban_members(guild_id, user_ids)[source]#

The unban_members function is a coroutine that takes in a guild_id and user_ids list. It then iterates through the users list, popping off the first user id from the user_ids list and passing it to unban_member function of each client. If there is no response or if there was an error, it will return None. Otherwise, it will yield back the response.

Parameters:

  • guild_id (int) â€“ Specify the guild id of the server you want to unban members from

  • user_ids (list[int]) â€“ Store the list of user ids to unban

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]
